newsitem.title: USA: NU says shutdown of plants increased costs.
newsitem.headline: NU says shutdown of plants increased costs.

text.p: Northeast Utilities on Tuesday attributed the bulk of the drop in its third quarter earnings to costs associated with the shutdown of its three nuclear power plants.

As result of the outages, at the Millstone complex in Waterford, the cost of fuel and purchased power rose to $308 million in the quarter compared to $243 million in the same period in the prior year.
The Millstone shutdown also propelled a rise in nonfuel operation and maintenance costs to $371 million in the quarter compared to $314 million during the same period in the prior year.
